creator: dummy@sogetthis.com
text:
The date is incorrect under one of the mentioned vulnerabilities under Fixed in Apache httpd 2.2.12.
Page: http://httpd.apache.org/security/vulnerabilities_22.html
See Update Released below, should be 27th July?

moderate: APR-util off-by-one overflowCVE-2009-1956
 An off-by-one overflow flaw was found in the way the bundled copy of the APR-util library processed a variable list of arguments. An attacker could provide a specially-crafted string as input for the formatted output conversion routine, which could, on big-endian platforms, potentially lead to the disclosure of sensitive information or a denial of service.
 Issue public: 24th April 2009
 Update Released: 72th  2009
 Affects: 2.2.11, 2.2.10, 2.2.9, 2.2.8, 2.2.6, 2.2.5, 2.2.4, 2.2.3, 2.2.2, 2.2.0
Thanks for reporting this - there was a zero too much in the date, which causes this buggy behavior. It has been fixed in r1448583.
creator: humbedooh@apache.org
